text: Hi everyone it's Helen here!
Today I will make "Bò nướng cuốn cải''
or grilled beef wrapped in mustard green.
This is a great option for barbeque parties of course,
and it is also a really nice drinking snack.
The way I marinate the meat in this recipe
it's a little bit different
than the normal way
and when I first found out about this method I was really surprised
how it can change the flavor
so stay tuned. Let's begin!
( music)
To marinate 500g of beef,
We'll need 1 shallot which should be peeled
and thinly sliced, 1 whole head of garlic
about 12 cloves
2 red chili peppers
and 2 to 3 bird's eye chilies.
You can use more or less chilies depending on how spicy you can take.
Finely chop the garlics and chilies
I use a processor here to safe time.
Next heat 2 tbs of vegetable oil in a pan
and fry the sliced shallots 'till slightly golden
and then add the minced garlics and chilies
and
fry until fragrance.
Then add 4 tbs of soy sauce,
2 tbs of sugar
1 tsp of chicken stock powder
stir and simmer for 1 minute to dissolve completely
and turn off the heat and leave to cool.
For the beef try to use tender cuts
like loin,sirloin or eye of round.
Cut the beef into strips about the size of your little(pinky) finger
about half and inch thick.
Then combine the beef with the marinate, mix well
and cover and chill in the refrigerator
for 1 hour or better overnight.
Normally, we'll put all the garlic,chilies
and seasoning directly into the raw meat
but by simmering it first like this
the smell is gonna be a lot more fragrant
and also the flavor of the seasoning is a lot deeper
when you grill. One thing about
grilling or cooking beef it's that you have to cook
it on high heat
and it will be great if you have a charcoal oven.
Today I will grill indoor with an electric grilling pan
and just wait for it
to turn really nice and hot
and then I'm gonna spread the meat out on the grilling pan
especially near to the griddle
so later it's gonna gets some nice grilling marks
flip to sear on all sides
if you want the meat to be pink inside
just cook for just 30 seconds or so.
To serve, tear a piece of mustard leave and wrap it.
and dip into the sauce
which is a mix of green chilies, salt,condensed milk and lime juice.
It's pretty simple right? But it's so so so so fragrant
and the flavor of the meat after grill
is much more deeper than
the normal method
of marinating
So I hope you will give it a try and if you do
please share the photo on instagram with #Helenrecipes. I'm always very excited to see your photos.
